nodes.bodyText:
The module import structure here seems a bit weird to me.
We have INT-SYMBOLIC import INT-SYMBOLIC-KORE and INT-COMMON, but INT-SYMBOLIC-KORE already imports INT-COMMON. Is this intentional @denis-bogdanas .
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -433,7 +433,25 @@ module INT-COMMON
                 | Int "dividesInt" Int    [function]
 endmodule
 
-module INT-SYMBOLIC [symbolic, kore]
+module INT-SYMBOLIC [symbolic]
+  imports INT-COMMON
+  imports INT-SYMBOLIC-KORE

nodes.bodyText: @ehildenb  INT-SYMBOLIC-KORE has different attributes and is not imported all the time. So all imports are needed.
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -433,7 +433,25 @@ module INT-COMMON
                 | Int "dividesInt" Int    [function]
 endmodule
 
-module INT-SYMBOLIC [symbolic, kore]
+module INT-SYMBOLIC [symbolic]
+  imports INT-COMMON
+  imports INT-SYMBOLIC-KORE
